medical_history.chief_complaint: Intractable pruritus associated with a giant congenital melanocytic nevus leading to life-threatening anemia from extensive bleeding skin excoriations.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began with localized pruritus in her bathing-trunk GCMN, progressively worsening and impairing her ability to walk. She had episodes of uncontrolled bleeding from excoriations in her perineal and perianal regions attributed to constant scratching. Despite numerous treatments, including various oral and topical antipruritic medications, the pruritus persisted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of severe anemia due to blood loss from perianal ulcerations and prior partial surgical reductions of the nevus.
